CHI Life Assurance Limited is a Subsidiary of Consolidated Hallmark Holdings Plc. The Company is licensed by the Insurance Regulator, the National Insurance Commission (NAICOM) and fully capitalized to the tune of N8 Billion in line with regulatory requirements. CHI Life formally commenced business transactions with the granting of operational licence on 10th March, 2025 with the primary focus of driving a very professional insurance institution using technology to deepen insurance penetration in Nigeria. We are poised to leverage on the exceptional service delivery and professional practice reputation of the parent company, Consolidated Hallmark Holdings Plc not only to meet but surpass the expectations of all stakeholders in prompt service delivery to customers and return on investment to shareholders.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Unit Head

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Lead, motivate, and manage a team of insurance agents to meet and exceed sales targets.
	Develop and implement strategic plans to grow the unit’s life insurance business.
	Monitor and evaluate the performance of agents, providing coaching and training as needed.
	Ensure all activities comply with industry regulations and company policies, including compliance with the Nigerian Insurance Act and NAICOM guidelines.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, agents, and stakeholders.
	Handle customer inquiries and resolve complaints efficiently.
	Prepare and present regular sales and performance reports to senior management.
	Facilitate recruitment, onboarding, and training of new agents.
	Conduct market research to identify new sales opportunities and potential clients.
	Collaborate with marketing and underwriting departments to optimize product offerings and client satisfaction.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / Bachelor's Degree with at least 2 years of work experience.


Salary
N110,000 monthly.

	Our client is seeking a Quality Control Assistant to support our technical operations team in maintaining high service and repair standards.
	The ideal candidate will assist in inspecting, testing, and verifying that all vehicles serviced in the workshop meet the required performance, safety, and quality benchmarks before delivery to customers.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in inspecting vehicles after repair or servicing to ensure quality workmanship.
	Verify that mechanical, electrical, and bodywork jobs meet company and manufacturer standards.

	Help monitor the use of approved spare parts and materials during repair operations.
	Participate in test drives (where necessary) to confirm service quality.
	Maintain proper QC records and reports for all inspected vehicles.
	Provide feedback to technicians and supervisors to improve repair accuracy and reduce repeat jobs.
	Ensure compliance with workshop health, safety, and environmental standards.
	Support customer satisfaction efforts by addressing quality-related feedback.

	Minimum of B.Tech, B.Eng, or HND in Mechanical Engineering, Automotive Technology, or related field.
	1&ndash;2 years of experience in vehicle repair, inspection, or a similar quality-related role.
	Strong attention to detail and a keen eye for detecting faults.
	Good knowledge of vehicle systems, diagnostics, and repair processes.
	Excellent communication, documentation, and teamwork skills.





Why Join Us?


	Be part of a dynamic and growing automobile workshop.
	Gain hands-on experience in quality assurance and automotive service excellence.
	Opportunities for career growth and professional development.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Accounts Officer",
  "description": "Izy Air Limited -&nbsp;Founded in 2011, our company has a clear mission: to revolutionize business charter across Africa. We&#39;ve consistently achieved this goal through a proven process that prioritizes safety, service quality, and punctuality.&nbsp;Our aircraft sales team is highly reliable and boasts a global reach, thanks to our international and regional affiliations. We offer professional advice on aircraft selection, legal structures for investment protection, and aircraft registration &ndash; whether brand new or pre-owned. We cater to first-time owners and those looking to expand their fleet.

We&#39;ve proudly served numerous influential individuals and corporations, providing comprehensive post-sales services. Our Management Program ensures complete peace of mind, offering support within the African market. We offer a one-stop solution for aircraft management, covering everything from crewing and accommodations to hangarage, ground handling, billing, scheduled and unscheduled maintenance, and even charter sales. You can place your aircraft in our charter fleet to boost your revenues, as our charter sales team is at your service.

With a strong presence in Nigeria, one of the fastest-growing emerging markets, our growth is unstoppable. We are a luxury private charter company dedicated to delivering seamless, world-class experiences for our elite clientele.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accounts Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Wuse, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The ideal candidate will ensure accurate financial record-keeping, assist in financial planning, and contribute to the financial control and reporting that support our strategic growth.
	This role is critical to ensuring regulatory compliance, cost efficiency, and sound financial decision-making in the aviation &amp; charter business environment.


Responsibilities
